choices.C: Configure the size of the payload in each frame to MTU 9000.
choices.E: Minimize the number of hops between the storage and the hosts.
choices.B: Enable iSCSI port binding on the initiator device.
choices.A: Use a software-based iSCSI adapter on the client side.
choices.D: Set the size of the payload in each frame to MTU 1500.

questions.question_text: A network architect designs the iSCSI architecture. The requirements are to achieve high performance and a low amount of oversubscription and to minimize latency. Which two actions must be taken to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
I would also choose B & E and the "most correct". MTU should be 9000 for iSCSI but thats a given.

comments.content:
Agree, but configuring the MTU = 9000 does not mean that all payloads should be of that size. In any case, the MTU options are badly redacted; not sure if intentionally or not.

B&E

discussion.content: I'll go with B and E

Selected Answer: BC
With port binding, the SCSI protocol will load balance across all bound ports and failover to other bound ports on link failure.

Selected Answer: C
Agree to C

Answer is C, Python is the most appropriate choice for orchestrating and automating a vendor-agnostic network, offering flexibility, ease of use, and broad support for running scripts on devices from multiple vendors. It provides an extensive set of libraries and is commonly used in network automation.

questions.question_text: An architect needs vendor-agnostic technology to orchestrate and automate a customer network with scripts. The technology must support running ad-hoc scripts from the CLI and support a deployment of scripts based on a large, readily available set of support libraries. Which technology must the architect choose?

A company must integrate an iSCSI storage solution into its existing production environment. The new iSCSI network must be accessible from a limited set of network segments. The client devices follow a strict network security policy to access critical data from the storage array. Which design steps must be used to meet these requirements?

choices.A:
Place the iSCSI storage appliance on the core switch to isolate it in a private VLAN.
Configure a token-based authentication between the storage array and the clients.
choices.C:
Connect the iSCSI storage appliance on the core switch using a dedicated port.
Apply the session mutual authentication (CHAP) method between the targets and initiators.
choices.B:
Deploy the iSCSI storage appliance on the core switch in a separate VRF.
Apply the session mutual authentication (CHAP) method between the targets and initiators.
choices.D:
Connect the iSCSI storage appliance on the core switch in vPC mode.
Configure a token-based authentication between the storage array and the clients.

questions.question_text:
An engineer needs to configure multiple network devices using Ansible. Device passwords must meet these requirements:
• be stored securely
• not be visible as plaintext
• be available to Ansible playbooks for executing scripts

Which solution must the engineer choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

choices.D: Encrypt the passwords within the Ansible inventory file.
choices.B: Store the passwords within a Git repository Secrets Manager.
choices.A: Encrypt a password variable file using Ansible Vault.
choices.C: Encrypt passwords as Ansible environment variables.

questions.question_text: An engineer must design Layer 2 connectivity for a subnet between two data centers. The engineer must ensure seamless host mobility and optimal first-hop routing. Which attribute must be synchronized across all data centers to achieve this goal?

discussion.content:
D is correct. 

Anycast Gateway MAC: This concept allows multiple data centers to present a single Layer 2 gateway MAC address to hosts, even though the gateways might reside in different physical locations. The anycast MAC address is configured on multiple routers or switches across different data centers, and the routing protocol ensures that the host always communicates with the closest or best-performing gateway. This setup enables seamless mobility for hosts as they move between different data centers (since the gateway MAC remains the same across data centers), and also provides optimal first-hop routing by ensuring that traffic is routed to the nearest available gateway.
